channel.title: Iraqi: I'm proud my WMD lies led to war in Iraq
channel.description:
LONDON – An Iraqi man whose testimony the United States used as a key evidence to build a case for war in Iraq says he is proud that he [b]lied about his country developing mobile biological warfare lab[/b]s. The Guardian newspaper published an interview Wednesday with Rafid Ahmed Alwan al-Janabi, who has been identified as the informer called "Curveball,"[b] whose claims about weapon labs formed part of then-U.S. Secretary of State Colin Powell's speech to the U.N. Security Council in 2003, shortly before the war began.[/b] The Guardian quoted al-Janabi as saying:[size=12pt][b] "I had the chance to fabricate something to topple the regime. I and my sons are proud of that."[/b][/size] Although some intelligence agents were skeptical of Curveball's story, the U.S. Senate Intelligence Committee reported in 2004 that the Central Intelligence Agency "withheld important information about Curveball's reliability" from analysts dealing with the case. The Guardian interviewed al-Janabi in Karlsruhe, Germany in a mixture of Arabic and German. The U.S. Senate panel's report said Curveball spoke in English and Arabic when he was interrogated by intelligence officers. [b]Asked about his feeling's about the deaths and destruction during the war and in the years following, The Guardian said al-Janabi said there was no other way.[/b] [b]"I tell you something when I hear anybody not just in Iraq but in any war (is) killed, I am very sad. But give me another solution. Can you give me another solution?" the newspaper quoted him as saying.[/b] [b]"Saddam did not (allow) freedom in our land," the Iraqi said. "There are no other political parties. You have to believe what Saddam says, and do what Saddam wants. And I don't accept that. I have to do something for my country. So I did this and I am satisfied, because there is no dictator in Iraq any more."[/b]
[url=http://news.yahoo.com/s/ap/20110216/ap_on_re_eu/eu_britain_iraq_curveball]http://www.foxnews.com/world/2011/02/16/wmdiraqclaim[/url] Very interesting, all bias aside.

item.title: Iraqi: I'm proud my WMD lies led to war in Iraq
item.dc:creator: @yakman yakman
item.description:
@yakman wrote:

Wow I cant believe the story has been spun this way. I read the interview in the Guardian and their interpretation seems much better.
The many western democratic governments lied to their people because they wanted to go to war. That’s really bad. If you look at the next electon in the UK, well, see wikipedia.

Blair's decline in popularity was largely attributed to the decision to send British troops to invade Iraq in 2003. The 2005 election also saw Britain gain more independent and small party members of parliament than it had done for 60 years.

Okay so an Iraqi man wanted coalition forces to invade but theres many countries run by bad people who we don’t invade. I’m sure plenty of Zimbabweans, Egyptians, Rwandans, Burmese and Sri Lankans want their dictator removed but thats not a good enough reason for the west to invade them.

Read full topic
item.source: Iraqi: I'm proud my WMD lies led to war in Iraq

item.title: Iraqi: I'm proud my WMD lies led to war in Iraq
item.dc:creator: @MujaheD Radeon
item.description:
@MujaheD wrote:

[quote=“Frell, post:26, topic:382765”][quote author=Mopman link=topic=478554.msg3503919#msg3503919 date=1297988917]
“Some people”?

You’ve been at war with them for 8 years…
[/quote]
Hes talking about the Kurdish uprising or whatever against Saddam (which Radeon claims was provoked by the CIA but has yet to find a source although I dont doubt it) he killed them, and then proceeded to gas the main Kurdish village and kill 3000 of his own people (including W&C) to make sure they didn’t do it again…[/quote]

en.wikipedia.org

Peshmerga

Peshmerga (Sorani Kurdish: پێشمەرگە‎, translit. Pêşmerge, lit. 'Before death', or Those who face death' IPA: [peːʃmɛɾˈɡɛ]) are the military forces of the federal region of Iraqi Kurdistan. Because the Iraqi Army is forbidden by Iraqi law from entering Iraqi Kurdistan, the peshmerga, along with their security subsidiaries, are responsible for the security of the regions in Iraqi Kurdistan. These subsidiaries include Asayish (intelligence agency), Parastin u Zanyarî (assisting Formally the peshmer...

That’s for 2003 and I’m sure they also had support in 1991 and when Saddam gassed them.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“Speljohan, post:21, topic:382765”][quote author=Frell link=topic=478554.msg3503736#msg3503736 date=1297978848]

He’s not a douche, the people who invaded Iraq are douches for believing him without intensive research and SOLID evidence.

Still, he claimed that rule under Saddam was bad, and used the war to bring him out of power. Thats the only positive.
[/quote]Shame the people weren’t capable/didn’t do what the Egyptians did.[/quote]
I think some people tried and were killed and buried in mass graves right? It is a shame it couldn’t have happened peacefully though.

item.title: Iraqi: I'm proud my WMD lies led to war in Iraq
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

[quote=“Radeon, post:17, topic:382765”][quote author=Lothy link=topic=478554.msg3503465#msg3503465 date=1297949772]
No, that statement just outlines what I see as a fitting punishment. I’m sure it’s a commonly held muslim belief.
[/quote]

It’s not a common nor an uncommon muslim belief. I can assure you that not a single muslim sect believes that an autopsy “affects their ability to enter the muslim afterlife”. Come on Lothy I didn’t expect you to be so gullible to TV![/quote]
Oh. NCIS is usually at least a little trustworthy. Gamed, I guess.

R.I.P RSC:

To Lothy’s defense, Ziva David is hot and she is a jew! But not really, because the actress who plays her comes from Chile!

This.

[quote=“Lothy, post:13, topic:382765”]I don’t think he’s extremist at all. His lies have cost the western world a lot of time and money though.[/quote]

According to one episode of NCIS where Ducky refused to perform an autopsy on a muslim at the father’s request, it affects their ability to enter the muslim afterlife. He would die in mental anguish, and would probably suffer so much more for it than a stint at Abu Ghraib.

That statement says otherwise.

Anyways, yes he is a total douche

According to one episode of NCIS where Ducky refused to perform an autopsy on a muslim at the father’s request, it affects their ability to enter the muslim afterlife. He would die in mental anguish, and would probably suffer so much more for it than a stint at Abu Ghraib.[/quote]I like how you automatically assume he’s an extremist muslim

item.title: Iraqi: I'm proud my WMD lies led to war in Iraq
item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

Lothy:

So what does this mean? Now knowing that key evidence that led to the war was falsified, is America going to pull out?

This was know before the war, why does countries use spies when they don’t listen to them. It would be a simple case to confirm WMD in Iraq if they know about them. But since they never checked and intelligence agency told them there was little reason for WMD, it shows that USA never cared for evidence.

My source (Norwegian): http://www.vg.no/nyheter/innenriks/artikkel.php?artid=10021799
few of you will understand it, but I post it anyways.

Read full topic

Lothy:

So what does this mean? Now knowing that key evidence that led to the war was falsified, is America going to pull out?

By the way we knew they HAD WMDs because we gave them to Saddam, but this Iraqi claimed they were developing them.
